result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry L. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

No contact with A.W. unless permitted by agent. 

Comply with any DHS recommendations. 

Attend parenting classes and follow through.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry L. Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Jerry L. Williams. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime if physical abuse of child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with A.W., DOB: 06-13-2006; I.W. and T.K.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
